meanings.definition: To provide support or reinforcement to a structure.
meanings.sent1: The workers were buttressing the bridge to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: The architect suggested buttressing the foundation to prevent any damage.
meanings.sent3: The team decided to buttress the treehouse with extra wood for added safety.
meanings.sent4: Her encouraging words acted as a buttress to his confidence during the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The friendship between the two countries served as a strong buttressing force in times of need.

meanings.definition: A structure built against a wall to support or reinforce it.
meanings.sent1: The ancient castle had impressive buttresses to hold up its walls.
meanings.sent2: The cathedral's buttressing was a key feature of its architectural design.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel thought the buttress was a great place to hide its acorns.
meanings.sent4: The mountain range acted as a natural buttress against the harsh winds.
meanings.sent5: The massive tree roots served as a natural buttressing system for the soil.
